description: A Licence is a permission for an entity to do something that would otherwise not be permitted. Note that such permissions are recorded in multiple different ways and to different granularity. In addition categories cross over, for example a pawnborker may be regulated as a retail establishment by a city, but also as a financial institution by a national or regional financial regulator. Sometimes the licence is a simple statement – the government of Rwanda has given a banking licence to a certain bank -- other times it is fine-grained and highly complex (e.g. an extractives licence or the UK FCA licencing scheme). This schema tries to make it easy to submit the former, while not losing granularity of the latter. The object has the name of Rich Licence to distinguish it from Simple Licence, which it is expected to ultimately replace.

_88alternative-name.description: An alternative name of a company, e.g. abbreviation, trading (including dba or doing business as), legal. As well as trading names etc, it can be used for storing alternative language representations of the legal name, in which case the language should be represented as two-letter ISO-639 code

_88share-parcel.description: A parcel of shares in a company

___voting_percentage_max.description: Maximum percentage of votes (if for example a band of votes is given)

___shareholders.description: Legal persons who own this share parcel

___name.description: Name of natural person or company

___type.description: Type of person if known (company or natural person)

___address_country.description: Country part of owner's address (for example if address not given)

___company_number.description: Company number, if company and known

___percentage_of_shares_max.description: Maximum percentage of shares (if for example a band of percentage is given)

___share_class.description: Share class or classes, if known

___voting_percentage_min.description: Minimum percentage of votes (if for example a band of votes is given)

___percentage_of_shares_min.description: Minimum percentage of shares (if for example a band of percentage is given)

$eref.description: The total number of shares a company has issued
A parcel of shares in a company

___voting_percentage_max.description: Maximum percentage of votes (if for example a band of votes is given)

___shareholders.description: Legal persons who own this share parcel

$eref.name: PreviousName
$eref.description: A previous name of a company

___con_date.description: The end (conversion) date of the name

___jurisdiction_code.description: Code representing the jurisdiction/company register which is the canonical record of the company’s existence. Uses underscored ISO 3166-2 to represent it, e.g. es for Spain, us_de for Delaware

___all_attributes.description: Other arbitrary attributes for a given company

___registered_agent_name.description: The 'Agent' of the company – a person or entity that is empowered to accept service for the company

___home_legal_name.description: The legal name of the 'home' company in its jurisdiction if this is a branch, and the name is different from the legal name of the branch

___jurisdiction_of_origin.description: The jurisdiction of the 'home' company if this is a branch

___home_company_number.description: If the entity is a 'branch', this is the company_number of the 'home' company in the home company's jurisdiction

___registered_agent_address.description: The address of the 'Agent', a public address to which legal papers can be served

___merged_into.description: Information on the merger of this company into a 'survivor' company

___surviving_company.description: the surviving_company that this has been merged into

___name.description: The legal name of the surviving company

___jurisdiction.description: The jurisdiction of incorporation of the surviving company

___company_number.description: The company_number of the surviving company, if known
unique identifier given by the corporate register with which it is incorporated

$eref.description: An officer (director, senior executive) of a company

___type.description: The type of entity that is the officer (either 'Person' or 'Company')

___person_uid.description: a unique identifier given to the individual (as opposed to the officership)

___uid.description: a unique identifier given to the officership

___jurisdiction.description: A free text field for the jurisdiction where the company is registered – this can be either the ISO 3166-2 code, the underscored version, or the standard name for the jurisdiction, e.g. France

$eref.description: An industry code from a standard code list (e.g. NAICS 2007 or NACE 2). This schema is a sub-schema of Classification.

___code_scheme_id.description: An identifier representing industry code scheme. At the moment these are eu_nace_2, uk_sic_2003, uk_sic_2007, us_naics_2002, us_naics_2007, be_nace_2008, dk_db_2007, nz_bic_2006, no_sic_2007, anz_sic_2006, nz_bic_2006, in_nic_2004_mca, ca_qc_cae, lu_nace_2. For other code schemes, or details of these, contact info@opencorporates.com

$eref.description: An identifier for an entity (possibly other things, e.g. securities in the future). Examples are tax IDs, non-profit IDs, SEC CIK numbers, Federal Reserve RSSD id. The main requirements for an identifier is that they should be well-defined, and issued by a government or have statutory standing

___identifier_system_code.description: An identifier representing the identifier scheme. Some examples of this are us_fein (US Federal tax number), us_sec_cik (US Securities and Exchange Commission CIK), uk_ew_cc (Charity Commission of England & Wales), lei (Global Legal Entity Identifier System)

___uid.description: The unique identifier given by the identifier system – it should be unique in the context of the identifier_system

$eref.description: An address with a type

An alternative name of a company, e.g. abbreviation, trading (including dba or doing business as), legal. As well as trading names etc, it can be used for storing alternative language representations of the legal name, in which case the language should be represented as two-letter ISO-639 code

___branch.description: A flag to denote whether a company is a branch entity. This should only be set if the company is a type of branch (otherwise should be null). In general the only option here is 'F' for a 'Foreign' branch, i.e. an out-of-jurisdiction entity that has registered as having a presence in the jurisdiction. In the US this is sometimes called a Foreign Corporation

$eref.description: A statutory filing

unique identifier given by the corporate register with which it is incorporated

___jurisdiction.description: A free text field for the jurisdiction where the company is registered – this can be either the ISO 3166-2 code, the underscored version, or the standard name for the jurisdiction, e.g. France

___branch.description: A flag to denote whether a company is a branch entity. This should only be set if the company is a type of branch (otherwise should be null). In general the only option here is 'F' for a 'Foreign' branch, i.e. an out-of-jurisdiction entity that has registered as having a presence in the jurisdiction. $eref.description: A person, for example, referenced in some other context, e.g. director of a company, shareholder, licence-holder, lobbyist. This should be used only if the person is the subject of the datum

___other_attributes.description: Use for other attributes for which we don't yet have curated schema attributes

___jurisdiction.description: Name of the jurisdiction in which the entity is based

___company.description: Company the person is representing. NB If the licence holder is a company, and the individual is a just a contact, then use the company-schema for the entity. This is where the individual themselves are the subject entity (e.g. licence holder, disqualified director)

___country_of_residence.description: The normal country of residence for the person

___uid.description: Unique id of the person. Note: the unique id is not expected to be globally unique, but only unique with reference to the source from which it is derived. No check is made for uniqueness

___registered_address.description: address for service (or address given in the context of legal requirement)

$eref.description: An entity which is a distinct organisation, but is not a company nor an individual. Examples include governments and governmental entities (e.g. Multilateral Development Banks, Government Departments, municipalities, etc), and also membership organisations

___other_attributes.description: Use for other attributes for which we don't yet have curated schema attributes

___jurisdiction.description: Name of the jurisdiction in which the entity is incorporated/domiciled (use global for global entities, e.g. UN)

___legal_form.description: legal form of organisation, e.g. municipality, government department, trust, etc

$eref.description: An entity of unknown type - potentially a company, a person, government entity, or some unincorporated organisation

___other_attributes.description: Use for other attributes for which we don't yet have curated schema attributes

___jurisdiction.description: Name of the jurisdiction in which the entity is incorporated/domiciled

___uid.description: Unique id for the entity if it has one

___uid.description: The unique identifier given by the identifier system – it should be unique in the context of the identifier_system

oneOf.name: Permission
oneOf.description: A permission issued by a government or regulatory body to an entity to do something. This may be fine grained,e.g. to sell liquor, to accept customer deposits, or broader, e.g to operate as a bank, a restaurant. It may also be permission to do something physical, such as explore for oil in a given area, or mine for iron ore

___restrictions.description: conditions or restrictions on the permissions

_88date.description: A parsed date object. This allows us to represent not just normal dates, but also partial dates too

___month.description: month part of date in numbers e.g. 11 for November, 4 for April

___day.description: day part of date in numbers

oneOf.description: The name of a person as an object

___family_name.description: The family name (often last name) of a person, as opposed to their family name. Following FOAF practice, this is preferred to last_name

___given_name.description: The given name(s) (often first name) of a person, as opposed to their family name. Following FOAF practice, this is preferred to first_name

___title.description: Title such as Mr, Ms, Dr etc

___suffixes.description: Any suffixes, including degrees, honours (OBE), ordinals (John Smith Jr, Bill Jones II) etc

___other_attributes.description: Use for other licence attributes for which we don't yet have curated schema attributes

___status.description: The status of the licence. If the licence is made up of a number of permissions, each of which has a status, store the status in the permissions field instead/as well

___jurisdiction_of_licence.description: The area in which this licence is valid

___source_url.description: Place where this fact can be verified

___end_date.description: The expiry date of the licence

oneOf.name: Permission
oneOf.description: A permission issued by a government or regulatory body to an entity to do something. This may be fine grained,e.g. to sell liquor, to accept customer deposits, or broader, e.g to operate as a bank, a restaurant. It may also be permission to do something physical, such as explore for oil in a given area, or mine for iron ore

___restrictions.description: conditions or restrictions on the permissions

___sample_date.description: Date on which we know this to be true (usually date this information was retrieved from the source)

$eref.description: An entity which is a distinct organisation, but is not a company nor an individual. Examples include governments and governmental entities (e.g. Multilateral Development Banks, Government Departments, municipalities, etc), and also membership organisations

___other_attributes.description: Use for other attributes for which we don't yet have curated schema attributes

___legal_form.description: legal form of organisation, e.g. municipality, government department, trust, etc

___retrieved_at.description: The time or date at which the source URL was requested

___start_date.description: The issue date of the licence

___licence_url.description: A public URL for the licence
